content:
Summarize the following: 

- Affectations refer to mannerisms, behaviors, or speech patterns that deviate from the norm and are used to express oneself or to fit in.
- Affectations may manifest in different ways, such as in speech, gestures, diction, dress/appearance, interactions, and vocabulary
- Everyone has some form of affectations, whether intentional or natural
- Affectations can be adopted naturally, for example due to environment, family, culture, or education
- Political figures have to be aware of affectations in order to communicate effectively with people from different cultures or backgrounds
- Affectations can cause tension in both political relations and day-to-day life.
- Affectations can change over the course of a marriage as the couple develops a shared identity.
- Spouses may adopt each other's affectations for various reasons such as to fit in, please the partner, communicate effectively, or show respect.
- Affectations may grow shared more quickly between a boyfriend and girlfriend depending on the length of the relationship, dynamics of the relationship, personalities and backgrounds of the individuals involved and context in which they interact.
- Businesses can have common affectations among their employees as a result of company culture, professional norms, and training
- Co-workers' shared affectations may present themselves outside of the workplace, for example in social events or online interactions
- Affectations may go unnoticed in a homogenous group or society because of shared cultural norms, lack of diversity, or group dynamics
- Within a homogenous group of people, differing affectations can manifest due to personal experiences, personality, education and profession, gender, social status, or external influences.
